channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14725] Vet categorization of tests so they for sure go into the right small/medium/large buckets
item.description:
I tried doing runSmallTests, runMediumTests, etc., and I noticed that some tests are larger than our categorization. At least for small tests it means they area all running in the one JVM. I also noticed that the categorization only takes effect in hbase-server.

This patch makes it so runSmallTests runs all the small tests only in each category. Also moves tests that were larger than small out to medium so they don't run in the one JVM anymore.
item.summary: Vet categorization of tests so they for sure go into the right small/medium/large buckets

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch also cleans out some old unused profiles and it makes an attempt at sizing the fork number by CPUs available – previous was hard-coded to 5.

fixing the firstPartGroups should happen in the top level pom where we first configure the primary surefire run (then the per-module customization can be removed everywhere). IIRC, I have a patch local where I implemented that part, lemme look.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12769670/categorization.patch
against master branch at commit bdf11be6af046e99cff9985968903d983d7ff10f.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12769670

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 21 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 43 javac compiler warnings (more than the master's current 35 warnings).

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16295//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16295//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16295//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16295//console

This message is automatically generated.

fixing the firstPartGroups should happen in the top level pom where we first configure the primary surefire run (then the per-module customization can be removed everywhere).

I tried that and it did not work for me. Would be interested in what you have Sean Busbey

no joy. Anywho, if you update top level pom:


diff --git a/pom.xml b/pom.xml

index 5bcdbc5..b69360d 100644

--- a/pom.xml

+++ b/pom.xml

@@ -567,6 +567,7 @@

             <failIfNoTests>false</failIfNoTests>

             <skip>${surefire.skipFirstPart}</skip>

             <forkCount>${surefire.firstPartForkCount}</forkCount>

+            <groups>${surefire.firstPartGroups}</groups>

             <reuseForks>false</reuseForks>

             <testFailureIgnore>${surefire.testFailureIgnore}</testFailureIgnore>

             <forkedProcessTimeoutInSeconds>${surefire.timeout}</forkedProcessTimeoutInSeconds>

then you can remove similar configs in individual modules. It used to be that we couldn't set it at the top level because then none of the hadoop-compat tests would run, but those are categorized as of HBASE-14516

Stuff has gone wonky. Maybe the update to 2.19...

Sean Busbey I tried that and it wasn't working for me (that was what I tried first). Let me have another go at it....

I tried that and it did not work for me. Would be interested in what you have Sean Busbey

huh. can you describe the failure? It should behave exactly as it does if you provide groups on the command line ala:


TEST_GROUP=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.SmallTests mvn test --fail-never -DreuseForks=false -Dsurefire.firstPartForkCount=1 -Dsurefire.skipSecondPart=true -Dgroups=$TEST_GROUP
let me kick off a run local while I'm at it

Yeah. I know. Failure is this that when I do mvn test -PrunSmallTests, when it gets to ...

Building Apache HBase - Procedure 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT

... it runs among others, a test labelled largetests:

Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 37.997 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.TestProcedureReplayOrder

I thought it was stuff like annotation parse of...

@Category(

{MasterTests.class, LargeTests.class}

)

... and a few other bits of hackery...
Sean Busbey hmmm... now it works.... hmm.... Thanks for the intervention.
Incorporate Sean feedback.

+1. I don't think properly restricting the first part execution is the cause of the second part running too long.
